events.event_name: Learn from the champions! Join the international showcases of fiscal data usage champions
events.event_purpose: Since its origins in 2017, over 25 events (Rallies or Dataquests) have been held in 13 different parts of the world, each with their own flavor and style thanks to the commitment and passion of visionary public officials and civil society organizations’ members. Nonetheless, the drive of these events are of course the participants. That’s why this year we’ll celebrate the winning teams from 2022 events in 2 online events where we will learn from 3 Asia based winners: Indonesia, Mongolia and the Philippines, as well from 4 Latin America based ones: Bogotá, Colombia; Chile (national level), Guanajuato State, Mexico; and Mexico (national level).   If you want to organize or participate in upcoming events in 2023, or you are simply an enthusiast of public budgets being used for public good and sustainable development, these events are for you!

Open Data Week is an annual festival of community-driven events organized and produced by the NYC Open Data Team at the Office of Technology and Innovation (OTI), BetaNYC and Data Through Design.  Every year, New Yorkers come together online and across the five boroughs to celebrate New York City’s Open Data Law, which was signed into law on March 7, 2012. Coincidentally, the first weekend of March is also International Open Data Day.  With these dates anchoring Open Data Week, we rally NYC’s civic tech and open data communities and offer opportunities for more people to learn about and engage with municipal open data.
events.organisers:
NYC Open Data Team at the Office of Technology and Innovation
BetaNYC
Data Through Design

Contact us at team@open-data.nyc

events.event_purpose: BetaNYC’s annual community conference invites New Yorkers to engage with the City’s technology, data and design communities during Open Data Week.

events.event_name: Open Data Day - Mogi das Cruzes 2023
events.event_purpose: Esperamos que o evento proporcione a atração da sociedade civil e dos servidores para discutirmos e pensarmos sobre dados abertos. O objetivo é transmitir informações e conhecimento sobre dados, ferramentas de análise e Lei de Acesso à Informação. Neste ano teremos uma série de atividades que abordarão os temas "Inteligência Artificial, Dados Abertos e Cidade Inteligente". A ação contará com oficinas exclusivas para servidores: "Como a Desinformação e as Fake News impactam as Políticas Públicas", "Oficina Agentes de Governo Aberto: inovando no setor público", "Dados Abertos e Desenvolvimento Sustentável" e "Simplificando a LGPD". Já as palestras de "Inteligência Artificial resolvendo desafios das cidades", "Utilizando dados para inteligência no combate ao crime", "Cidade Inteligente: usando dados para melhorar a vida dos mogianos" e a oficina de "Python na Prática" são abertas para todos os interessados.
events.organisers:
Prefeitura de Mogi das Cruzes. 
daniellesilva@mogidascruzes.sp.gov.br
smtda@mogidascruzes.sp.gov.br
